<title>Source</title>

<b>function source(val:string|array, options:object=void):void</b>

The <b>source()</b> command is used to include javascript files, eg.

    <pre class=verbatim>
<b>var</b> x = 1;
<b>source</b>(<i>'dir/foo.js'</i>);
foo(x);
</pre>

Nesting <b>source</b> calls are supported to a default maximum depth of 100.

You can also call <b>source</b> with an array of files, as in:

    <nowiki><pre class=verbatim>
<b>source</b>([<i>'foo.js'</i>,<i>'bar.js'</i>]);
</nowiki></pre>


We can configure and introspect various source related data the usual way:

    <nowiki><pre class=verbatim>
<b>Interp.conf</b>({<b>maxIncDepth</b>:10});
<b>var</b> cur = <b>Info.script</b>();
<b>var</b> dir = <b>Info.scriptDir</b>();
</nowiki></pre>


Source also can take an second parameter containing options,
for which the following options are available:

    <table border='1' class=optstbl>
<tr><th>Option</th> <th>Type</th> <th>Description</th> <th>Default</th></tr>
<tr><td>debug</td><td>INT</td><td>Debug level.</td><td> </td><tr>
<tr><td>index</td><td>BOOL</td><td>Setup for load of jsiIndex.jsi files.</td><td> </td><tr>
<tr><td>isMain</td><td>BOOL</td><td>Set Info.isMain() to true.</td><td> </td><tr>
</table>
